A C E F G H I L M N P S

A

addHelp(boolean, boolean, boolean) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Adds the `help' switches to the argument list.
addMatch(String, Object) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
addMatch() adds an argument to the match list, keyed by its identifier.
addNonSwitchSpec(String, String, boolean, String, Class) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
addNonSwitchSpec() is called by clients to add non-switch args to the list recognized by the parser.
addSwitchSpec(String, char, String, boolean, String, boolean) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Convenience version of addSwitchSpec() for switches that don't take arguments (and therefore don't need to have them specified).
addSwitchSpec(String, char, String, boolean, String, String, Class, boolean) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
addSwitchSpec() is called by clients to add switches to the list recognized by the parser.
args - Variable in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
args is initialized to the input arguments in the constructor

C

com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt - package com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt
Classes for parsing command-line arguments

E

errorMessage - Variable in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
errorMessage is set by any of the parsing methods, if they can't parse the input.

F

findSwitchSpec(String) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Finds the switch arg specification, if it exists, based on the supplied arg.

G

getArg(String) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
getArg() gets an argument from the match table, if it is there, or null otherwise.
getBadDoubleMessage() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Called to get an error message if an argument defined to be a double could not be converted to a double
getBadIntegerMessage() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Called to get an error message if an argument defined to be an integer could not be converted to an integer
getDouble(String) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
getDouble() gets the specified argument as an double primitive.
getDoubleOrDefault(String, double) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
getDoubleOrDefault() gets the specified argument as a double primitive, or returns the supplied default if the argument was not specified.
getDuplicateSwitchMessage() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Called to get an error message if a switch is supplied more than once.
getErrorMessage() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Retrieves the last error message, if any.
getInt(String) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
getInt() gets the specified argument as an int primitive.
getIntOrDefault(String, int) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
getIntOrDefault() gets the specified argument as an int primitive, or returns the supplied default if the argument was not specified.
getLeftoverArgs() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Returns an array of command-line arguments that were not matched as switches.
getMissingArgumentMessage() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Called to get an error message if a switch that requires an argument does not have an argument.
getMissingCompulsoryArgumentMessage() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Called to get an error message if an argument defined to be compulsory was not supplied on the command line
getShortUsage() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
getShortUsage() returns a String that can be output to the console.
getString(String) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
getString() gets the specified argument as a String.
getStringOrDefault(String, String) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
getStringOrDefault() gets the specified argument as a String or returns the supplied default if the argument was not specified.
getUnmatchedSwitchMessage() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Called to get an error message if a switch name is not matched.
getUsage() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
getUsage() returns a String that can be output to the console.

H

handleArg(Popt, String, Object) - Method in interface com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.PoptParseHandler
This method is called by the Popt parser every time it matches an argument.

I

ignoreCase - Variable in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
ignoreCase is initialized in the constructor

L

leftoverArgs - Variable in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Args not matched by the parser, set in parse() and available through getLeftoverArgs()
longFormShort - Variable in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
longFormShort is initialized in the constructor

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
The main() method tests the JavaPopt parser.
matchTable - Variable in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Table of matched args that were parsed

N

nonSwitchSpecList - Variable in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Store non-switch specifications as supplied by the client

P

parse() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
parse() processes the command-line arguments
parseNonSwitchArgs() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
parse() processes the command-line arguments that are _not_ switches.
parseSwitchArgs() - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
parse() processes the switch command-line arguments, writing anything left over into leftoverArgs
Popt - class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt.
Java command-line argument parser V1.0 See `overview' for information on how to use this class.
Popt(String[]) - Constructor for class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
The Popt constructor takes an array of Strings, typically as supplied on the command-line to a program, and uses default settings for the strictness parameters.
Popt(String[], boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean) - Constructor for class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
The Popt constructor takes an array of Strings, typically as supplied on the command-line to a program, and a set of flags controlling the strictness of the parsing process.
poptParseHandler - Variable in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Application defined parse handler
PoptParseHandler - interface com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.PoptParseHandler.
Java command-line argument parser V1.0 See `overview' for information on how to use this interface (c)2001 Kevin Boone/Web-Tomorrow, all rights reserved

S

setLeftoverArgs(String[]) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Sets the array of command-line arguments that were not matched as switches.
setPoptParseHandler(PoptParseHandler) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
setPoptParseHandler sets that supplementary parser handler.
supplied(String) - Method in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
supplied() returns true if the command-line contained the specified argument.
switchSpecList - Variable in class com.web_tomorrow.utils.javapopt.Popt
Store switch specifications as supplied by the client
